feed.title: Google Cloud: Google Agentspace
feed.subtitle: Changelog for Google Cloud product: Google Agentspace

entry.content:
Google Agentspace: Configure prompt chips

You can create, delete, edit, and enable or disable Google-provided and custom prompts that provide better guidance to your users.

For more information, see Configure prompt chips.
entry.summary: Configure prompt chips to guide users with custom and Google-provided prompts.
entry.title: Feature: Prompt Chips Configuration

entry.content:
Google Agentspace: Generate images using Nano Banana (GA)

Image generation and editing with Nano Banana (Gemini 2.5 Flash Image) is generally available (GA) in Google Agentspace across Global, EU, and US multi-regions.

For more information on generating images, see Generate an image.
entry.summary: Image generation and editing powered by Nano Banana (Gemini 2.5 Flash Image) is now generally available in Google Agentspace. This feature is accessible across Global, EU, and US multi-regions, allowing users to create and modify images within the platform.
entry.title: Feature: Nano Banana Image Generation Now Available in Agentspace

entry.content:
Google Agentspace: Manage image and video generation on the web app

By default, image and video generation are enabled in the Agentspace web app. To turn off these features, admins must navigate to the Configurations > Feature Management tab, and turn off the Enable video generation and Enable image generation options.
entry.summary: Admins can manage image and video generation settings within the Agentspace web app.
entry.title: Feature: Image and Video Generation

entry.content:
Google Agentspace: Knowledge base filter for catalog entities in ServiceNow connectors (GA)

In your ServiceNow connectors, you can filter your knowledge base entities by catalog IDs. This lets you selectively ingest only those catalog entities whose catalogSysId matches the filter. If no values are specified, then the connector ingests all catalog entities. This feature is Generally available (GA).

For information about ServiceNow connectors, see Connect ServiceNow.
entry.summary: You can now filter knowledge base entities in ServiceNow connectors by catalog ID to selectively ingest data. If no filter is applied, all catalog entities will be ingested. This feature is Generally Available.
entry.title: Feature: ServiceNow Connectors Now Support Filtering Knowledge Base Entities by Catalog ID

entry.content:
Google Agentspace: Interface updates

  • File uploads can be canceled at any time.
  • The Star and Share buttons now appear after a user has initiated a session by submitting a prompt.
entry.summary: File uploads can now be canceled at any time. Additionally, the Star and Share buttons are now visible after a user has started a session by submitting a prompt.
entry.title: Changed: File uploads can be canceled

entry.content:
Google Agentspace: Change in ACLs for incidents in ServiceNow

The access-control list (ACL) behavior for ServiceNow incidents has significantly changed, from too permissive to least-privilege behavior. This change drastically reduces the possibility of data leaks, but might be too restrictive for your needs.

For more information about ServiceNow, see Connect ServiceNow and Add ServiceNow actions.
entry.summary: ACLs for ServiceNow incidents have been updated to a least-privilege model, enhancing data security and reducing leak risks.
entry.title: Breaking: ServiceNow Incident ACLs Updated

entry.content:
Google Agentspace and Google NotebookLM Enterprise: Model Armor

Model Armor helps proactively screen prompts and responses within Agentspace apps and NotebookLM Enterprise instances. For more information on how administrators can enable this feature, see:

  • Enable Model Armor in Google Agentspace
  • Enable Model Armor in NotebookLM Enterprise
entry.summary: Model Armor proactively screens prompts and responses in Agentspace apps and NotebookLM Enterprise. This feature helps enhance security and control over your AI applications.
entry.title: Feature: Model Armor: Proactive Screening for Agentspace and NotebookLM Enterprise

entry.content:
Google Agentspace: Real-time sync (Public preview)

Real-time sync uses webhooks to receive notifications when data is created, updated, and deleted in a third-party data source. Notifications typically arrive within minutes of the event. The following data stores support real-time sync:

  • Jira Cloud
  • Confluence Cloud
  • Microsoft OneDrive
  • Microsoft SharePoint Online
  • ServiceNow

Support for real-time sync for these data stores is in Public preview.
entry.summary: Real-time sync is now available in public preview. This feature allows you to receive notifications when data is created, updated, or deleted in supported third-party data sources within minutes of the event.
entry.title: Feature: Real-time sync now in public preview

entry.content:
Google Agentspace: Interface updates

  • The LLM model selector has moved from the search bar to directly below the product logo in the top-left corner.
  • The web grounding tool and source has been renamed Google Search and Enterprise web search, depending on the type of web grounding configured.
  • The Sources button in the search bar has been renamed Data.
  • The Data menu (formerly Sources) now shows which sources are selected.
entry.summary: The LLM model selector has been relocated to the top-left corner, below the product logo. Web grounding tools and sources have been renamed for clarity, and the 'Sources' button is now labeled 'Data', which also indicates selected sources.
entry.title: Changed: Interface Updates in Google Agentspace

entry.content:
Google NotebookLM Enterprise: Notebook creation and management using the API (GA)

Use standalone APIs to programmatically create and manage your notebooks. For more information, see Create and manage notebooks using the API.
entry.summary: Programmatically create and manage notebooks with NotebookLM Enterprise API.
entry.title: Feature: NotebookLM Enterprise API

entry.content:
Google NotebookLM Enterprise: Generate podcasts using the Podcast API (GA with allowlist)

Use a standalone API to programmatically generate NotebookLM-style podcasts. No data store required; provide the source content directly to the Podcast API.

This feature is available to select Google Cloud customers (GA with allowlist). For more information, see Generate podcasts (API method).
entry.summary: A new API allows you to programmatically generate podcasts using NotebookLM-style content. No data store is needed, as you can provide source content directly to the Podcast API. This feature is available to select Google Cloud customers.
entry.title: Feature: Generate podcasts programmatically

entry.content:
Full sync in SharePoint connector to avoid duplicate documents

Because of a change that tries to optimize the sync performance, performing an incremental sync in a SharePoint connector data store can cause duplicate documents for file entity types. This is applicable to all SharePoint connectors created before August 21, 2025, that contain file entity types.

As a one-time solution, you can avoid duplication by either running a full sync manually or waiting for the next scheduled full sync. After performing the full sync, you can perform incremental syncs without generating any duplicate documents.
entry.summary: Avoid duplicate documents in SharePoint connector with a full sync.
entry.title: Breaking: SharePoint Connector Duplicates

entry.content:
Google Agentspace: Export analytics

Export metrics to a BigQuery table in your Google Cloud project using the analytics:exportMetrics method.

For more information, see View and export analytics data.
entry.summary: Export metrics to a BigQuery table using the `analytics:exportMetrics` method.
entry.title: Feature: Google Agentspace: Export analytics

entry.content:
Google Agentspace: Custom starter prompts for no-code agents

You can add starter prompts to no-code agents. Starter prompts guide users on how to interact with the agent. See Create a no-code agent with Agent Designer.
entry.summary: You can now add starter prompts to no-code agents. Starter prompts guide users on how to interact with the agent.
entry.title: Feature: No-code agent starter prompts
